text:
Hi,
I'm trying to deploy a chaincode, and here is the error returned during image creation:

```
# <http://golang.org/x/sys/unix|golang.org/x/sys/unix>
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/syscall.go:76: missing function body for "use"
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/syscall_linux_amd64.go:67: missing function body for "gettimeofday"
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/syscall_unix.go:52: missing function body for "Syscall"
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/syscall_unix.go:53: missing function body for "Syscall6"
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/syscall_unix.go:54: missing function body for "RawSyscall"
src/golang.org/x/sys/unix/syscall_unix.go:55: missing function body for "RawSyscall6"
```

I'm not sure if it's related, but security is enabled. Does it look familiar to anybody? Thanks.
Edit: when creating an image outside of fabric, it works perfectly.

i am getting an error while deploying a chaincode with security enabled
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-346f9fb:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/peer$ peer network login test_vp0                                                                    Enter password for user 'test_vp0': ************

Usage:
  peer network login [flags]

Flags:
  -p, --password="": The password for user. You will be requested to enter the password if this flag is not specified.


Global Flags:
      --logging-level="": Default logging level and overrides, see core.yaml for full syntax
      --test.coverprofile="coverage.cov": Done
  -v, --version[=false]: Display current version of fabric peer server

Error: Error on client login: rpc error: code = 2 desc = "grpc: the client connection is closing"
<@U1XPBJQJX>: Is the peer running and have you set CORE_PEER_ADDRESS environment variable?
yes peer is running nd i have set the CORE_PEER_ADDRESS also

ok, I've no idea what's going on, sorry :confused:
it seems to be a connectivity issue; is the peer on the same machine as the client? Is there any firewall involved?
@Ibonniot:Yup peer is in the same machine
